headline: Bloom Energy Fuels AI Data Center Power With US$2.65b Deal
summary: Bloom Energy (NYSE:BE) has signed a 20 year offtake agreement with an American Electric Power subsidiary to supply solid oxide fuel cells valued at US$2.65 billion. The company has also entered into a new partnership with Brookfield Asset Management focused on supplying on site power solutions for AI data centers worldwide. These agreements position Bloom Energy as a provider of long duration, on site power for digital infrastructure customers, including AI workloads. Bloom Energy builds...

headline: Assessing American Electric Power Company’s Valuation After Its US$2.65b Fuel Cell Deal And 20-Year Offtake Agreement
summary: Fuel cell deal and 20-year offtake set the stage American Electric Power Company (AEP) has advanced its fuel cell power generation plans by committing to a roughly $2.65b solid oxide fuel cell purchase and securing a 20-year offtake agreement for a Wyoming facility. See our latest analysis for American Electric Power Company. The fuel cell commitment and renewed focus on regulated utilities come as American Electric Power Company’s share price sits at US$119.43, with a 1-month share price...
